photo.description: L'Ange Pleureur in the Amiens Cathedral. During the First World War allied soldiers sent postcards home of the angel weeping with it's arm resting on a skull. Thus it became a symbol for the despair of the Great War.
photo.tags: france angle mary john jesus angel crying despair wwi great war church cathedral amiens stained glass light red orange purple wings sun freeassociation skull
photo.title: The Weeping Angel
